Sentence: Blore, Lombard, and Armstrong run to help her (Vera), only to return downstairs to find Wargrave draped in a curtain that resembles courtroom robes and bearing a red mark on his (Armstrong) forehead
Armstrong examines the body and reports that Wargrave has been shot in the head
When Armstrong arrived, Wargrave pushed him (Armstrong) over the edge into the sea, then returned to the house and pretended to be dead

Once Vera hanged herself on a noose that he (Armstrong) prepared for her (Vera), Wargrave planned to shoot himself in such a way that his (Armstrong) body would fall onto the bed as if it had been laid there
